alert.note: Alert for Moffat (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 1:08PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT AND RESERVOIR RELEASES IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT FRIDAY FOR ELKHEAD CREEK... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt and reservoir releases is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Colorado, including the following counties, Moffat and Routt along Elkhead Creek above Elkhead Reservoir to the confluence with the Yampa River. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Elkhead Creek will continue to rise due to excess runoff from snowmelt and reservoir releases. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 108 PM MDT, Gauge reports indicated snowmelt due to heavy runoff from snowmelt and reservoir releases. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Elkhead Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... rural areas of Eastern Moffat and Northwestern Routt Counties from above Elkhead Reservoir to the confluence with the Yampa River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
